title: Dorset and Hampshire: Live - Tuesday 27 September - BBC News
summary: news and sport on tuesday 27 september .
the poole-based company which operates alton towers is fined £ 5m following last year 's rollercoaster crash .
a section of rail line near fareham will be closed for nine days next month .
investigations begin into a fire which badly damaged flats in romsey .
weather : becoming brighter with a high of 18°c .

documents.title: that 's all for today
text: we 'll be back tomorrow from 08:00 .

documents.title: blackpool v portsmouth
text: preview followed by live coverage of tuesday 's league two game between blackpool and portsmouth .
of course , if you 're in the radio solent region , you 'll also be able to listen in on 96.1fm and on dab radio .
pompey are currently second in the bottom tier of the football league - can they continue their recent good form ?
they 're are facing blackpool , who just like the visitors , were in the premier league not that long ago .

documents.title: man charged over weymouth crash
text: a man has been charged over a crash in weymouth yesterday .
three vehicles , including two police cars , were damaged in the incident near chafey 's roundabout at lunchtime .

dorset police said a 22-year-old man from liverpool had been charged with dangerous driving , failing to stop for police , contravening his licence , driving without insurance and assaulting a police officer .
he is due before bournemouth magistrates tomorrow .
# latestnews - man charged following collision in weymouth

documents.title: comment on council tax support changes
text: residents across purbeck , west dorset and weymouth & portland can comment on areview of the council tax support scheme .
proposed changes would bring the scheme in line with the changes made by central government in housing benefit and universal credit .
in 2013 , the government made councils responsible for schemes to replace council tax benefit .
the council is looking to make the scheme more efficient and less costly .
if the councils keep the current scheme it would be more complex to operate , making the service inefficient and more costly .
the proposals set out in this consultation will provide savings and allow us to deliver the service more efficiently .

documents.title: fire destroys flat in southampton
text: fire has wrecked a flat in southampton .
crews were called to the maisonette in kent street at about 14:15 .
the blaze completely destroyed the second floor , while the first floor was severely damaged by smoke and water .
no one was inside but two people were taken to hospital needing treatment after breathing in smoke .

documents.title: serious flat fire in southampton
text: red watch @ twitterid @ twitterid deal with a serious flat fire in southampton # redwatchtotherescue # teamhants

documents.title: breakingprison criticised over inmate death
text: a jury has criticised the care offered to an inmate at winchester prison who hanged himself in his cell in july last year .
it concluded that there were missed opportunities to assess or reassess haydn burton 's risk of self-harm or suicide .
it said prison staff failed to review his care once he was deemed to be at risk .
the jury at winchester coroners court said it was more likely than not that prison staff had been informed that mr burton had prepared a noose the night before he was found .
coroner grahame short said he would write to the ministry of justice with a series of recommendations for improvement .
author: James Ingham
BBC South Today

documents.title: travel : accident in kinson
text: the a341 wimborne road in bournemouth is partially blocked and there 's slow traffic in both directions at the horsham avenue junction , because of an accident .
for the latest , visit the bbc travel pages .

documents.title: travel : broken down lorry blocking a35
text: the a35 is partially blocked and there are delays westbound between monkeys jump roundabout in dorchester and the longland 's lane junction in winterbourne abbas because of a broken down lorry and an oil spillage .
for the latest , visit the bbc travel pages .

documents.title: romsey fire : residents back 'within 24 hours '
text: a new block of retirement flats in romsey , which suffered a fire yesterday evening , will be `` fully operational within 24 hours '' , the developer has said .
renaissance retirement said it hoped to move residents back into the building in duttons road by thursday .
the ringwood-based firm said three out of 52 apartments had suffered `` light cosmetic damage '' .
a spokesman said the fire originated from a generator and spread to an adjacent balcony , setting off an alarm which immediately alerted the fire brigade .

text: emergency works are taking place on new road in southampton city centre .
new road ; is closed westbound between six dials & east park terrace .
emergency works are taking place

he 's been spotted in the cosham area of the city .

documents.title: alton towers crash : 'it will never be repeated '
text: the chief executive of poole-based merlin entertainments , which has been fined £ 5m over last year 's rollercoaster crash at alton towers , says the firm is `` utterly determined '' to avoid any future accidents .
speaking outside stafford crown court , nick varney ignored repeated questions from reporters as to whether he would resign .
he said the firm was not an `` emotionless corporate entity '' and the crash would not be forgotten .
`` in this context , the far greater punishment for all of us is knowing that on this occasion we let people down with devastating consequences , '' he said .

documents.title: athletics club woe over floodlight ban
text: an athletics club has claimed it is facing collapse because of a ban on the use of floodlights at its training ground .
portsmouth 's mountbatten centre lights have been switched off since a 34-year-old man was electrocuted at an adjacent football pitch in january .
portsmouth athletics club chairman phil budd said the council and operators were `` letting down grassroots sport '' .
the council said it was working on a `` long term solution '' .

documents.title: train line closed for nine days
text: buses will replace trains running west from portsmouth for nine days next month .
a section of rail line near fareham will be closed between 22 and 30 october , while engineers replace the track and nine sets of points .
passengers on south west trains , great western railway and southern railway services will be affected .
network rail says the £ 4.6m project will provide track which will `` last for decades '' .
the project includes a £ 1m upgrade to fareham station , with reduced parking while the work takes place .

documents.title: alton towers crash : a 'catalogue of errors '
text: families involved in the alton towers crash have been giving their reactions , after poole-based merlin entertainments was fined £ 5m .
speaking outside court , paul paxton , representing eight of the victims , said his clients had been `` shocked and disappointed by the catalogue of errors '' .
a report from the health and safety executive ( hse ) had concluded the accident could have been avoided .
bernard thorogood , prosecuting for the hse , said engineers on the day had not read or seen the ride 's operating instructions .
he also pointed out there were estimated winds on the day of the crash of 45mph but the manufacturer 's manual stated the ride should not be operated at wind speeds above 34mph .

documents.title: row over eddie mitchell 's sandbanks pavilion revamp plans
text: a row has erupted over plans by former afc bournemouth chairman and developer eddie mitchell to revamp a seaside pavilion in dorset .
previous plans to demolish sandbanks pavilion and create a 2,000-seater sports stadium were turned down in april .
but a resubmitted scheme to restore the 1920s building and create 16 new beach huts at the site has since been given the go-ahead .
however , some borough councillors are angry the new plans were not discussed by the planning committee first .
lib dem councillor philip eades has called for the issue to be discussed at tonight 's full council meeting .

documents.title: reprieve for hampshire 's cricketers ?
text: hampshire could get a last-minute reprieve from relegation to division two of the county championship , bbc radio solent has reported .
the england and wales cricket board ( ecb ) is considering docking points from rivals durham after giving the club financial support to survive the season .
a source at the ecb has told the bbc that , if that 's the case , hampshire would stay up because durham had an unfair financial advantage over them in the fight to avoid the drop .

documents.title: alton towers crash : 'catastrophic failure '
text: the judge , who has fined poole-based merlin entertainments £ 5m following last year 's rollercoaster crash at alton towers , said human error was not the cause as the firm had suggested at first .
judge michael chambers qc described the crash as a `` catastrophic failure '' .
`` this was a needless and avoidable accident in which those who were injured were lucky not to be killed , '' he said .
but he said he accepted the defendant had taken full and extensive steps to remedy the problems that led to the crash .

documents.title: what to expect from the weather
text: bee tucker has the latest weather forecast

documents.title: alton towers crash : firm admitted safety breaches
text: a £ 5m fine for the dorset company which runs alton towers follows the firm 's admission of health and safety breaches over last year 's crash on the smiler rollercoaster .
sixteen people were injured in the crash last june , including two teenage girls who needed leg amputations .
merlin entertainments , based in poole , admitted the breaches at a court hearing in april .

documents.title: breakingalton towers operator fined £ 5m
text: the poole-based firm which operates alton towers has been fined £ 5m , following last year 's rollercoaster crash which injured sixteen people .

documents.title: pompey head to blackpool
text: portsmouth could go top of league two with a win at blackpool tonight .
paul cook 's side are buoyant after a 5-1 victory over barnet at fratton park on saturday .
radio solent 's live commentary from 19:00 bst will be on all hampshire frequencies as well as freeview 722 .
blackpool v # pompey preview :

documents.title: southampton road closed after water damage
text: stoneham lane in southampton will remain closed until thursday night , following yesterday 's water main burst .
southern water says its engineers had to remove a 70ft ( 21m ) ash tree last night to make room to excavate the main .

documents.title: fewer prosecutions for domestic violence
text: hampshire has seen a big fall in the number of people charged with domestic violence offences , according to a new report .
solicitors simpson millar said prosecutions were down 42 % this year , compared to the same period in 2015 .
the report comes after figures from the crown prosecution service wessex region showed that fewer people were prosecuted for violence against women and girls in 2015 compared to 2014 .
emma pearmaine from simpson millar said the cause might be cuts to legal aid rather than a drop in the number of actual offences .
a cut in the legal aid budget has had a negative impact on the level of access people have to legal advice ; this could now be having serious implications for abuse victims .

documents.title: drugs warning at soundclash festival
text: hampshire police is setting up `` drug amnesty bins '' at a music festival near ringwood on saturday .
the force is promising `` robust '' enforcement of drugs laws , including the ban on new psychoactive substances .
festival-goers warned of drug dangers as 17,500 people expected at hampshire event

documents.title: weather : dry and pleasant
text: after a damp start , brighter conditions will move in from the north west later in the afternoon with some sunshine .
it will feel pleasant outside , with temperatures reaching 18c ( 64f )
tonight will be mostly dry with cloud generally clearing eastwards and some decent clear spells developing .

documents.title: duchenne muscular dystrophy drug offers new hope
text: a six-year-old boy with an incurable muscle-wasting condition has begun a costly pioneering treatment following a two-year fight by his family .
luca fernandes , from poole , has duchenne muscular dystrophy ( dmd ) , which could leave him unable to walk by the age of 12 .
his parents have been campaigning for him to be given translarna - a treatment that could allow him to lead a normal life for much longer .
they said the sachets of the drug were `` like powdered hope '' .

text: report of a broken down coach causing congestion on the a31 at canford bottom .

documents.title: watch : fire damage at romsey flats
text: here is the scene in duttons road , romsey , this morning , following the fire yesterday evening at a block of retirement flats .
fire crews from romsey , eastleigh , st mary 's and redbridge managed to stop the flames spreading to most of the building .
the fire service says three flats were damaged and 21 people were found alternative accommodation .
fire destroyed one section of this new block of flats in romsey yesterday evening .
everyone was evacuated safely .

documents.title: watch : crews tackle flats blaze
text: about 20 firefighters tackled the blaze at new retirement flats in romsey last night .
the fire started in a generator outside the property in duttons road .
21 people had to be found alternative accomodation .

documents.title: fire 'in noisy generator ' at new romsey retirement flats
text: fire has damaged a brand new block of flats which had been the focus of complaints about noisy generators .
crews were called to the retirement apartments in duttons road , romsey , shortly after 19:30 bst .
last week , neighbours complained they were being disturbed by generators brought in to provide power to residents while building work was ongoing .

documents.title: good morning
text: welcome to local live for dorset , hampshire and the isle of wight .
we 'll be bringing you the latest news , sport , travel and weather updates .
you can get in touch via email , on our hampshire and dorset facebook pages or on twitter @ bbc hampshire and @ bbcdorset .
